Title: Keyboard Shortcuts
Description: Comprehensive reference of all application keyboard shortcuts.

Topics.Title: Navigation & General
Topics.Summary: Shortcuts for navigating the application and general actions.
Topics.Content:
Navigation & General Shortcuts

ActionDefault Key
Open HelpF1
Getting StartedCtrl+F1
Keyboard ShortcutsCtrl+Shift+K
Switch to Inventory TabCtrl+1
Switch to Remove TabCtrl+2
Switch to Transfer TabCtrl+3

ActionDefault Key

Reset FormCtrl+R
Open Advanced EntryCtrl+Shift+A
Toggle Right Panel (Right)Ctrl+Right Arrow
Toggle Right Panel (Left)Ctrl+Left Arrow

Topics.Title: Quick Buttons
Topics.Content:
Quick Button Shortcuts

Quick Buttons 1 through 10 are mapped to Function keys F1 through F10 (excluding system reserved keys).

ButtonDefault Key
Quick Button 1F1
Quick Button 2F2
Quick Button 3F3
Quick Button 4F4
Quick Button 5F5
Quick Button 6F6
Quick Button 7F7
Quick Button 8F8
Quick Button 9F9
Quick Button 10F10

Note: If F1 is reserved for Help, Quick Button 1 may be remapped or unavailable depending on configuration.

Topics.Title: Customizing Shortcuts
Topics.Content:
Customizing Shortcuts

You can customize keyboard shortcuts to suit your workflow.

  1. Go to Settings > Shortcuts.
  2. Find the command you want to change.
  3. Click the ... button.
  4. Press the new key combination.
  5. Click Save.

If the shortcut is already in use, you will be prompted to replace it.

Topics.Title: Editing Shortcuts
Topics.Content:
Editing Shortcuts

For advanced users, you can edit shortcuts directly in the shortcut editor.

The editor allows you to see all assigned shortcuts and filter by category or key.
